remarks: Two ways of saying that an element of a group is the identity element. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 25-Feb-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
grpinveu.1 $e |- X = ran G $.
grpinveu.2 $e |- U = ( GId ` G ) $.
grpoid $p |- ( ( G e. GrpOp /\ A e. X ) -> ( A = U <-> ( A G A ) = A ) ) $.
